title: NASA grapples with budget cuts as it undertakes ambitious programs
summary: "Naturally, we have to make hard choices."

title: SpaceX gets E-band radio waves to boost Starlink broadband
summary: SpaceX has secured conditional approval to use extremely high-frequency E-band radio waves to improve the capacity of its low Earth orbit Starlink broadband constellation.

title: NASA says spending caps force “hard choices” for its 2025 budget
summary: NASA says its fiscal year 2025 budget proposal is constrained by the second year of a debt-ceiling agreement that caps overall spending, leading to delays, potential cancellations and broader uncertainty for many NASA science programs in particular.

title: Dawn of the multi-orbit era
summary: Multi-orbit broadband is about to get an important test run, as terminals that can switch between satellites in LEO and geostationary orbit come online.

title: Kymeta brings in new leadership amid multi-orbit antenna launch
summary: Flat panel antenna maker Kymeta is refreshing its leadership team as the company prepares to start shipping its first multi-orbit broadband user terminal.

title: SpaceX launches back-to-back Starlink missions
summary: The two launches took place yesterday evening, just over five hours apart, from Space Launch Complex-40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station...

title: Space Force budget holding steady amid Pentagon’s fiscal constraints
summary: The Pentagon in its 2025 budget proposes $29.4 billion for the U.S. Space Force

title: DoD unveils investment strategy for its Office of Strategic Capital
summary: The Pentagon is seeking $144 million for OSC, created to attract private investment for tech companies in sectors like space, AI and cybersecurity

title: Buy Before Build: SSC’s Commercial Space Office seeks to disrupt business as usual
summary: COMSO Senior Materiel Leader Col. Richard Kniseley and Deputy Director Jeremy Leader explain how the Space Systems Command seeks to make use of commercial space assets instead of developing systems in-house.

title: Space loves AI, AI doesn’t love Space
summary: Operators are developing creative solutions for putting AI on satellites, a challenge that comes with myriad technical and logistical obstacles.
